page.title: 18EARITH BRITISH SCHOOL
page.content: {Sixty}years ago Earith School had{3 {classes.}Children went to school from the age of{3 years.}In the{first class children used{sand trays}to copy numbers and letters. They stayed in this class until they were 6 or 7. In the{middle}class children did{ {exercises}in the{playground}for half an hour every day. After that they did {sums}then{spelling}or{reading.}Girls did{sewing}or{knitting}in the afternoon and the boys did{drawing. Children stayed in that class until they were 11 or 12 years old. In the{ {top}class the{headmaster}used to teach the children. They had{wooden tables} with{inkwells}and used exercise books. The girls did{cooking}and the boys{ {carpentry.}Every morning there was an{ {inspection}of shoes,finger nails,ears and nose. We have found out about this from an old pupil.
